questions.question: What are enzymes' role in biological systems?

choices.answer: to control a balanced reaction
to speed up reactions by increasing the activation energy
to lower the activation energy of a reaction
none of the above

questions.question: How might an enzyme be activated OR inhibited?

choices.answer: depending on what binds to the active site
depending on the temperature of the environment
depending on the pH
all of the above

questions.question: If we want to see the effectiveness of a particular enzyme inhibitor, how would we be able to measure that?

choices.answer: by the amount of substrate produced
by the amount of product formed
by the quickness of the reaction
by the type of reaction that occurs

questions.question: Denaturing an enzyme may result in the substrate's inability to bind

choices.answer: True
False

questions.question: The amount of substrate present does not impact the speed of an enzymatic reaction.

choices.answer: True
False

questions.question: The goal of cellular respiration is...

choices.answer: to produce CO2 from O2 and create ATP
to produce CO2 from glucose and create O2
to produce glucose from CO2 and create ATP
to create ATP, using glucose and O2 and creating CO2

questions.question: Which stage of cellular respiration requires oxygen DIRECTLY?

choices.answer: glycolysis
pyruvate oxidation
the Citric Acid cycle
the ETC

questions.question: Why is oxygen necessary in cell. resp.?

choices.answer: it acts as the final electron acceptor
it acts as the agent to produce ATP
it acts as an enzyme to promote glucose breakdown
it forms a compound that generates ATP

questions.question: What is the role of CO2 in photosynthesis?

choices.answer: it acts as the final electron acceptor
it is used in the LIGHT RXNS to produce glucose
it is used in the CALVIN CYCLE to produce glucose
it is produced as a by-product in the ETC

questions.question: What would happen during photosynthesis if there was a lack of sunlight?

choices.answer: the photosystems will not be able to capture solar energy
the Calvin cycle will not be powered, since it receives sunlight
there would not be too much affect, since ATP is still created
the plant would lose too much water and die

questions.question: How are stomata and photosynthetic rates related?

choices.answer: stomata play a role in capturing sunlight
stomata play a role in gas exchange
stomata play a role in CO2 formation
stomata play a role in ATP production

questions.question: Sunlight is directly converted into glucose during photosynthesis

choices.answer: True
False

questions.question: During hot days, plants will most likely produce more glucose

choices.answer: True
False
